intro: Anabasis ehrenbergii, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that thrives in sandy soils and is well-adapted to harsh desert conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water in dry environments. Anabasis ehrenbergii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for desert wildlife.
